stories.text:
Hi, when I started to work remotely I was looking for ways to keep in touch with my colleagues on the not work-related stuff. As someone who loves sport and gets motivation from other people, I built an app called Spurr for teams to run asynchronous challenges. For example, you can run 500 miles together, do 10,000 pushups, 100 minutes of plank, etc… or design your own challenge based on your unique team culture. It's just a bit of fun and next time on Zoom I have a great small talk topic with people who are in my challenge.

How do you keep in touch with your colleagues while working remotely? Do you not have fatigue from Zoom events? Thanks for any feedback!
stories.title: Show HN: Spurr · Asynchronous Team Building and Fitness Challenges

stories.text:
So I wanted to book some places for my next holidays on Airbnb and I came on the most annoying CAPTCHA I ever saw

https://i.postimg.cc/sXppmyxm/airbnbdes.png

Now you have to make sum of dices only to acces the website. And 5 times in a row.

And be sure to make no mistake ! I unfortunatly did on the fifth/last one (was getting really p*ssed), and had to start over !

So this morning I had to make around 50 dices sum just to acces this website.

I don't kow who came with this idea, but I find this really bad.
stories.title: Tell HN: Airbnb just stole me 5 minutes of my time adding dices
